result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarvis D Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and mandatory surcharges by 1/18/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for employment, employment searches or school. Defendant to report by 11/27/2015 by 5:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarvis D Griffin in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24 FOR JUDGE DEE, BRANCH 37.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jarvis D Griffin in court, attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski via-telephone.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jarvis D Griffin in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea Hearing.  Defense request for adjournment granted; no objection from the state.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarvis D Griffin in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
-Defendant's Authorization For Attorney To Appear And Act; received, filed and signed by the Court on May 28, 2015.

Attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarvis D Griffin in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is not public defender eligible, additional time given to retain counse.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Randall H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jarvis D Griffin in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/9/15 @ 1:30pm
